remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated Center Tank Boost Pump is considered inoperative.

note.para: Additional deferral required – L(R) Center Tank Boost Pump.
Flight crew must perform a manual computation of ZFW + Center Tank Fuel Weight and compare this value to the maximum ZFW to ensure that the flight will not exceed MAX ZFW.

numlitem.para: Prior to takeoff, verify one crossfeed is open and remains open until center tank fuel usage is terminated.
Initialize FMC with aircraft's actual weight and balance ZFW (Basic Operating Weight and payload).
Ensure fuel quantity in main tanks is adequate to reach a suitable airport. The low pressure light is operative on remaining pump, and center tank quantity indication is operative.
Should the operative center fuel pump fail after departure the center tank fuel plus ZFW must not exceed the maximum ZFW limitation 200,000 lbs. and remains within C.G. limits for landing.
These restrictions can be verified by applying the following adjustments to the ZFW/CG values from the original load manifest:
Add the center tank fuel to the zero fuel weight from the load manifest. The zero fuel weight plus center tank fuel must not exceed the maximum structural zero fuel weight.

To determine the effect of the center tank fuel on balance, refer to the following graph. This graph shows the normal forward CG limit line and revised forward CG limit lines as a function of center tank fuel.
To use the graph, find the appropriate revised forward CG limit line for the center tank fuel load.
Plot the zero fuel weight, including center tank fuel, versus the zero fuel weight CG, as shown on the load manifest.
If the point falls aft of the revised forward CG limit, and forward of the aft CG limit, the aircraft is within balance limits.

note.para: If within balance limits at takeoff, aircraft will remain within limits whether or not center tank fuel is used.

numlitem.para: The aircraft's ZFW (Basic Operating Weight and payload) plus center tank fuel weight may not exceed 200,000 lbs.

note.para: Do not use balance control fuel procedures.

numlitem.para: Center tank fuel quantity must be considered unusable if remaining pump fails.

placard.para: Placard near upper EICAS screen "L(R) UNIVERSAL FAULT INTERRUPTER (UFI) INOP" as appropriate and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Open and collar affected pump C/B on P6:
L OVRD - P6F14 R OVRD - P6F20
